title: z46_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German destroyer Z46. Character designed by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]], voiced by [[Chihara Minori]]. 

In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], with a [[tattoo]] on her right leg. 

Her default outfit consists of a blue [[beret]], a [i][[Reichsadler|Parteiadler]][/i] [[hair ornament]], a [[sleeveless]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[dress]] with a [[frilled dress|frilled white inner layer]], [[black jacket]], a [[black cape|black-]][[red cape]], and red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge strapped to her cape, two 128 mm twin gun mounts, and two 37 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, while she uses a [[sword]] as her melee weapon.

h4. Skins

title: gaza-b
body:
A fan created fictional military manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]AMX-002 Gaza-B[/b] 

An early transformable [[mobile_suit|MS]] fielded by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. It is the predecessor to the mass produced [[Gaza-C]].

Created in [[real life]] by [[Kitsukawa Ryounei]].

title: moon_gundam
body:
[b][i]Mobile Suit Moon Gundam[/i][/b] (機動戦士MOONガンダム, 機動戦士ムーンガンダム) is a 2017 [[Gundam]] manga written by Fukui Harutoshi with art by  Kosai Takayuki. 

It is published in [[Gundam Ace]] magazine by Kadokawa and is currently ongoing.

The manga is set in a [[space_station|space colony]] during the Universal Century and the events of [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]].

h4. [[Mobile suit]]s featured

** [[Varguil]]
** [[Psycho Gundam Mk-IV G-Doors]]
* [[Rick Dijeh Kai]]
* [[Jeddah (mobile suit)|]]

* [[Dag Doll]]
* [[Gaza-G]]

title: lovander
body:
[quote]Seeking a night of love, it is always chasing someone around. At first it only showed interest in other Pals, but in recent years even humans have become the target of its debauchery.[/quote]

A [[Pal (Creature)|]] from [[Palworld]], Paldex entry no. 69 (yes, that's intentional). Lovander is a majority female, pink bipedal lizard with a heart motif. She is famed for being a canonical sex pest, to the point that not even humans, Pal Tamers or otherwise, are safe from her insatiable lust.

title: fengguan
body:
A type of traditional Chinese headgear for women. It was worn mainly by noblewomen during the Ming Dynasty for ceremonies or official occasions; it is also worn by brides during weddings¹.

Fengguan means "phoenix crown", a name that originates from its adornments: phoenixes made of inlaid kingfisher feathers, as well as gold dragons, beaded pheasants, pearls and other gemstones. Sometimes they are adorned with decorative wings - called diyi - instead of beads. 

h4. See also
* [[chinese clothes|Chinese clothes]]
* [[tag group:headwear]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Fengguan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fengguan

h4. Notes
¹ The are several different variations of the fengguan's design, so the design can vary greatly. Traditionally, the number of dragons, pheasants and phoenixes on the hat denoted the wearer's rank.

title: stippling_(texture)
body:
A shading technique, where shadow is applied using dots of varying density. Often done by hand in [[traditional media]], but in digital media, digital brushes can replicate this effect. 

For artwork made up entirely of dots, see [[pointillism]].

For the similar dot-like shapes seen in manga screentones and [[pixel art]], see [[dithering]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23215628
* !post #8179216


h4. See also
* [[Hatching (texture)]]

h4. External links
"Wikipedia: stippling":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stippling]

title: pointillism
body:
Artwork made up entirely - or almost entirely - out of dots. 

For artwork where only the shading is made up dots, see [[stippling (Texture)|]].

h4. See also
* [[Fine art parody]]
* [[Impressionism]]

title: mizura
body:
One of Japan's oldest hairstyles, worn by [b]men[/b] in the ancient period. It consists of two ponytails, could be long or short, one on either side of the head. These are looped down and back up, each then being secured in place with some sort of wrapping (string, [[hair tie]] or [[hair tubes]]... ). Mizura was worn differently according to social status.

Mizura may be confused with [[shuangyaji]], but this style is for [b]women[/b] & [b]girls[/b], and is often higher up on the head or lower back, being more varying.  

H4. Examples
* !post #7149571
* !post #7945917
* !post #4372604: (Mizura on the upper character.)
* !post #627253
h4. See also
* [[double bun]]
* [[hair rings]]
* [[twintails]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

h4. External links
* "A History of Men’s Japanese Clothing and Accessories (by Joshua L. Badgley)":http://www.sengokudaimyo.com/garb/garb.ch04.html
* "Symbolism of Hairstyles in Korea and Japan":https://nirc.nanzan-u.ac.jp/nfile/708

title: shuangyaji
body:
A Chinese women's hairstyle which consists of two [[hair bun]]s, sometimes [[braid|braided]]. It resembles two small coils on the top of the head or beside the forehead; sometimes resembling hair bows made of the person's hair. During the [[Song Dynasty]] in China, it was common for maids and young girls to wear such hairstyle.

Not to be confused with [[mizura]], which is for men.
* !post #3791615
* !post #7711901
* !post #7791361

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: golshi's_grand_adventure_2
body:
A endless runner/shooting game within [[Umamusume: Party Dash]], where you play as [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]], jumping over obstacles and blasting through a horde of robot horse girls to (ostensibly) save [[Mejiro McQueen (umamusume)|]] and dropkick Professor Kale (if he even exists).

Unlike the main game's modern pixel art, Golshi's Grand Adventure 2 is presented in a 8-bit style based on the NES/Famicom.

The brand spread into a media franchise from the late 1980s onwards, spawning films, shows, etc. It is owned by [[united_states|American]] toy company "MATTEL, INC.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mattel

title: umamusume:_party_dash
body:
A party/action game set in the [[Umamusume]] universe released for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[Steam (platform)|]] worldwide on August 30th 2024.

While it's a licensed Umamusume game, it's also a continuation of the various [[kunio-kun series|Kunio-kun sports games]], being developed by [[Arc System Works]], the current caretakers of many Technos properties. It also features [[Golshi's Grand Adventure 2]], a 8-bit style game within the game.

title: liangbatou
body: Chinese hairstyle/headdress worn traditionally by [[Manchu clothes|Manchurian]] women during a period of the [[Qing dynasty]] - namely, through the 19th century. The hair is wrapped around a long frame known as a bianfang to create a rigid, wingspan-like shape. The hair is then decorated with flowers and hairpins. h5. Examples * !post #7401728 * !post #7691730 For the larger, more elaborate version of this headdress that came later in history, see the [b][[dalachi_(headdress)|]][/b] tag. H4. title: hair_flowing_over
body:
Long, flowing hair that is draped over an object, item, or irregular surface in such a way that demonstrates proper observation of hair physics and/or gravity. 

Not to be confused with [[floating hair]], which is hair blowing in the wind, or [[hair spread out]], which is hair spread over a surface.

h4. Examples

* !post #4395413
* !post #7842708
* !post #4356688

h4. See also

* [[long hair]]
* [[very long hair]]
* [[absurdly long hair]]
* [[hair spread out]]

title: floating_hair
body:
Hair that is blowing in the [[wind]], floating in midair, or otherwise not being held down by gravity.

Generally does not apply to [[tail]]s or hair that is messy or styled to appear gravity-defying.

Not to be confused with [[hair flowing over]], which is hair draped over a surface, or [[hair spread out]], which is hair spread over a surface, or  [[detached hair]], which is hair magically disconnected from the head.

h4. Examples

* !post #5185453
* !post #5637813

h4. See also

* [[hair floating upwards]]

title: blocked_senses
body:
The blocked senses tag is to be used in cases where a character in a image is unable to feel/use (part of) their senses.
This tag is meant for the full blocking of senses, where a character really cant feel anything trough magic or a physical/neurological condition.

This tag should not be used in cases where a character is blindfolded and/or has earplugs.
(In these cases the senses are not really blocked, it is more that stimulation is intercepted before it can reach the body)
For those cases please use the tag: [[sensory_deprivation]]

title: sex_pistols_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Guido Mista]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as six very tiny humanoids numbered 1-7 (there is no 4). Each has its own personality, but they all love eating.

The Sex Pistols attach to bullets fired from Mista's [[revolver]], allowing him to change their trajectory and ricochet off of objects freely.

Namesake is the English punk rock band [[Sex Pistols]].
other_names: セックス・ピストルズ

title: how_do_we_tell_him?_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a screenshot of the [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]] episode "Dying for Pie" in which [[Mr. Krabs]] and [[squidward_tentacles|Squidward]] contemplate how to tell [[spongebob_squarepants|Spongebob]] that he had eaten an explosive [[pie]] and would die by the end of the day. An edited version has them consider just killing him outright.

title: harem_outfit
body:
A form of clothing usually worn by bellydancers. Thus, the ensemble usually emphasizes a bare [[midriff]] and includes a [[bra]], [[bustier]] or [[tube top]]. There may be [[baggy pants]], [[harem pants]], [[loincloth]] or a long [[skirt]] over the legs, as well as possibly a flowing [[headdress]] or [[veil]] and loose sleeves. Jewelry in the form of [[earrings]], [[bracelet]]s, [[necklace]]s or [[anklet]]s may be present. One or more of these articles may be [[see-through clothes|sheer]].

The [[Dunhuang style]] may be mistaken for/look a lot like harem style clothing. 

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: nazuna_(flower_knight_girl)
body:
English Name: Shepherd's Purse
Birthday: 27th July
Age: Otona-desu.

The mascot and player's assistant in Flower Knight Girl. She serves primarily as the lore guide in the game, as although she is a personification of her namesake flower, she is not a Flower Knight herself.

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[green ribbon]], with a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[white dress]] and [[elbow gloves]] with a large [[green bow]] behind that emphasize her [[large breasts]] and a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] skirt that exposes her [[panties]].

Her [[osanai nazuna|younger alter ego]] made her debut as a virtual Youtuber on 27th August 2018, one month after Nazuna's birthday.

title: invisible
body:
When a character is completely transparent and cannot be seen by either the viewer or another character. Their clothes may or may not be invisible as well.

If a character is not fully invisible but instead partially [[transparent]], then tag as [[transparent]]. If clothes are partially transparent, use [[see-through clothes]].

h4. See Also

title: azuma_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese large cruiser [i]Azuma[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Kishiyo]], voiced by [[Yasuno Kiyono]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3480676.[/tn]

As a shipgirl, Azuma is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[yellow_eyes|golden-colored eyes]], along with animal ears similar to [[takao_(azur_lane)|Takao]] and [[large_breasts|a sizeable bust]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white jacket]] hanging off her shoulders, likely based off Imperial Japanese Navy [[military uniform]]s, a button-up shirt with her [[lace-trimmed bra]] [[see-through clothes|visible past the shirt]], a black [[pleated skirt]], [[black gloves]], and dark-colored [[pantyhose]]. Her personality is similar to [[atago_(azur_lane)|Atago]], being very "onee-san" and gently teasing the Commander. 

Her [[rigging]] is themed to act as a chair for her to sit on, with her three 310 mm triple gun mounts to her sides (two on left, one on right) on bow pieces, as well as two 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] to her sides at shoulder level. She also has a reconnaissance seaplane to her lower left, while she uses a [[katana]] as a melee weapon.

h4. Trivia
Azuma is a never-built ship based on one of Japan's Project B-65 proposals. The B-65 project was intended to create a "super-cruiser" meant to replace the aging [[Kongou (Azur Lane)|]]-class battlecruisers and lead the IJN's cruiser squadrons into a planned "Decisive Battle" against the US Navy. Her purpose during such an engagement was to lay down heavy barrages against American heavy cruisers while being resistant to any return fire from them. While extensive design work had been carried out, no ships were laid down as Japan's focus shifted to replacing their extensive carrier losses after the [[battle of Midway]] and materials grew scarce. 

As a reference to World of Warships, as per the collab, Azuma gains an ability based off of the "Demolition Expert" skill, increasing her high explosive damage and chance to set fires. 

h4. Skins
* [[azuma_(lily-white_longing)_(azur_lane)|Lily-White Longing]]
* [[azuma_(soft_voice_of_spring)_(azur_lane)|Soft Voice of Spring]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Design B-65":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_B-65_cruiser]

title: castle_of_cagliostro
body:
[i]Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro[/i], also known as [i]Rupan Sansei: Kariosutoro no Shiro[/i], is a 1979 Japanese animated comedy-drama crime action film co-written and directed by [[Miyazaki Hayao]] as his feature film debut. 

It is the second feature film featuring Monkey Punch's master thief [[Arsene Lupin III]], from his manga series Lupin III.
 
The film was Miyazaki's first time directing a theatrical feature after having previously worked as an animator for [[Toei Animation]] and TMS Entertainment and directing several shows including [[Lupin III]] and two episodes of [i]Lupin III Part II[/i].

American director [[Steven Spielberg]] considers a car chase sequence in the film as the best animated work of all time.
other_names: ルパン三世カリオストロの城

title: sex_pistols
body: The Sex Pistols are an English punk rock band formed in [[London]] in 1975. Although their initial career lasted just two and a half years, they became one of the most culturally influential acts in popular music. The band initiated the punk movement in the [[United Kingdom]] and inspired many later [[punk]], post-punk and alternative rock musicians, while their clothing and hairstyles were a significant influence on the early punk image.

title: the_who
body: The Who are an English rock band formed in London in 1964. Their classic lineup (1964–1978) consisted of lead vocalist Roger Daltrey, guitarist Pete Townshend, bassist John Entwistle and drummer Keith Moon. They are considered one of the most influential rock bands of the 20th century.

title: mount_kilimanjaro
body:
[b]Mount Kilimanjaro[/b] (/ˌkɪlɪmənˈdʒɑːroʊ/) is a dormant volcano in [[Tanzania]]. With three volcanic cones — Kibo, Mawenzi and Shira — it is the highest mountain in [[Africa]] and the highest single free-standing [[mountain]] above sea level in the world: 5,895 m (19,341 ft) above sea level and 4,900 m (16,100 ft) above its plateau base. It is also the highest [[volcano]] in the Eastern Hemisphere.

Kilimanjaro is the fourth most topographically prominent peak on [[earth_(planet)|Earth]]. It is part of Kilimanjaro National Park and is a major hiking and climbing destination. Because of its shrinking glaciers and ice fields, which are projected to disappear between 2025 and 2035, it has been the subject of many scientific studies.

Place of a pivotal [[mecha]] battle in the [[Zeta Gundam]] science fiction anime series.

title: zeta_gundam_define
body:
A 2011 [[science fiction]] manga by [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]]. It is part of the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam Define[/b] is a new [[comic]] format retelling of the events from the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985 (of which Kitazume was the main character designer). It features more modern designs as well as new mecha and characters.

title: primrose_field_illusion
body:
The Primrose Field Illusion is an [[optical illusion]] created by Professor Akiyoshi Kitaoka, a Japanese psychologist and expert in visual perception. The illusion features a simple pattern of light green and dark green squares, with primroses (magenta and white) in the corners of the squares.

When viewed, the pattern appears to undulate or wave, creating a sense of motion. This illusion is an example of a peripheral drift illusion, where the brain interprets static visual information as dynamic motion. The Primrose Field Illusion is particularly striking due to its use of color, which enhances the perceived motion.

The illusion works by exploiting the way the brain processes visual information. Our brains are wired to recognize patterns and motion, and the Primrose Field Illusion takes advantage of this by presenting a subtle, gradient-like pattern that our brains interpret as movement. The use of color and the specific arrangement of the squares create a sense of depth and dimensionality, further reinforcing the illusion.

In much of her fan art, she has a rather surly disposition, particularily due to her obsession with the number 10 and a pun on her name ("kiriban" is a Japanese slang for [[milestone_celebration|nice numbers]] that were often associated with subscriber/post like count).

title: eiyuuou_bu_wo_kiwameru_tame_tenseisu:_soshite_sekai_saikyou_no_minarai_kishi
body:
Eiyuu-Ou bu wo Kiwameru Tame Tensei Su ~Soshite Sekai Saikyou no Minarai Kishi♀~ (English Title: "Reborn to Master the Blade: From Hero-King to Extraordinary Squire") is a 2019-to-present Japanese fantasy light novel series written by Hayaken and illustrated by [[Nagu]].  The series began publication as a webnovel in early 2019, with the light novel and manga adaptation starting late 2019 .  A mini two-episode net anime aired in late 2020, and a tv anime adaptation was announced on November 2021.

h4. Major Characters

* [[Inglis Eucus]]
* [[Rafinha Bilford]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reborn_to_Master_the_Blade:_From_Hero-King_to_Extraordinary_Squire]
other_names: 英雄王、武を極めるため転生す

title: shredder_(tmnt)
body:
Primary antagonist of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]] franchise. A ruthless ninja and leader of the now-criminal [[Foot Clan]], clad in bladed armor pieces and a face-plated helmet. Once known as Oroku Saki, the Shredder murdered [[Master Splinter|Splinter]]'s master Hamato Yoshi before the rat's mutation.

h4. See also

* [[Paper Shredder]]

title: master_splinter
body:
[i][[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]][/i] character. 

The martial arts teacher of the four turtle brothers and their parental figure. In most continuities, he was related to a Japanese man named Hamato Yoshi before his mutation. Continuities differ on whether or not he was Yoshi's pet or Yoshi himself.

title: edelweiss_(flower)
body:
Edelweiss is a [[mountain]] [[flower]] belonging to the [i]Asteraceae[/i] family. Characterized by its [[white flower|white]] fuzzy petals in an asymmetrical double-star formation and yellow clustered florets. It is the national flower of [[Austria]] and [[Switzerland]].

h4. Examples

title: hydrangea
body:
A genus of [[flower]]ing plants of the [i]Hydrangeaceae[/i] family, native to southern and eastern Asia. Most species are [[bush|shrubs]], but some are small trees. Commonly called [b]hortensia[/b].

Hydrangeas bear globular or umbrella-shaped clusters of flowers that come out any time from early spring to late autumn in a variety of colors influenced by the pH level of the soil. Commonly depicted in shades of blue, purple, and pink.

In Japan, it is commonly associated with the [[rain]]y season. Its Japanese name is "ajisai" (アジサイ or 紫陽花), which refers specifically to [i]Hydrangea macrophylla[/i], the bigleaf hydrangea.

h4. Examples
* !post #7600469
* !post #7610132
* !post #6807721: Early blooming stage

h4. See also
* [[Allium (flower)|]]
* [[Hydrangea print]]
* [[Winter daphne]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Hydrangea":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrangea
* "Wikipedia: Hydrangea macrophylla":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrangea_macrophylla
* "Wikipedia: Hydrangeaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrangeaceae

title: kasodani_kyouko
body:
The "Echoing Sutra Chant". Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]].

A loud, enthusiastic youkai, she is a [[yamabiko]] who embodies mountain echoes and has the ability to reflect sound waves.

Because mountain echoes are no longer considered strange, she decided to enter [[Hijiri Byakuren]]'s Myouren Temple and adopt Buddhism. Pictured with a broom, cleaning the grounds and reciting sutras daily are among her duties.

h4. See also

* [[Choujuu Gigaku]], her band with [[Mystia Lorelei]] as the other member
* [[Heart Sutra]]
* [[Gyate gyate]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou: Kyouko Kasodani":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kyouko_Kasodani

title: alternate_species
body:
When a humanoid character is depicted as a member of a different humanoid race than their own. This includes humans being depicted as a fantasy race or [[alien]], as well as members of fictional races being depicted as other fictional races.

Do not use this tag when [[humanization]], [[monsterification]], [[slimification]], [[furrification]], or [[mechanization]] applies unless there is also an instance of alternate species in the same image.

h4. Examples

* !post #5764010: Human to [[Elf]]
* !post #5733438: Human to [[Octoling]] ([[splatoonification]])
* !post #6228304: Human to [[Na'vi]]
* !post #3024242: Humans to [[Draph]]s
* !post #5648383: Humans to [[Viera]] and [[Lalafell]]
* !post #4737095: Hylian to [[Gerudo]]
* !post #2708003: [[Harvin]] to [[Erune]]
* !post #3555861: [[Harvin]] to [[Draph]]

body:
When a character has [[breasts]] noticeably larger or smaller than their canonical size, usually by greater than two cup sizes.

Do not use when the character's canonical breast size is ambiguous (e.g. [[Izayoi Sakuya]] and [[Patchouli Knowledge]]).

title: svt-40
body:
The [b]SVT-40[/b] is a [[World War II]]-era Soviet semi-automatic [[rifle]] chambered in 7.62×54mmR, designed by Sergei Simonov.

Different from its predecessor, the [[SVT-38]], it is visually recognizable by having a pair of perforated metal heat shields that appear longer, covering both gas piston assembly on top and the barrel portion. A [[cleaning rod]] can also be stored underneath the barrel.

h4. Examples

* !post #6976493

h4. See also

* [[AVS-36]]
* [[List of Weapons]] 

h4. External links

title: bio_lab
body:
[[Ragnarok Online]]'s most famous dungeon, added in 2005 in Episode 10.2. Compared to most other dungeons featuring various monsters, the Bio Labs had enemies with names who mirrored the player classes. It also was much more difficult than most of the other dungeons at its level and had valuable drops. All of these factors made the Bio Labs one of the most popular spots to grind for levels and the rare monster cards. 

For tagging purposes, use this when the characters are shown with their characteristic aura (such as post #4320593), or the laboratory ruins are present. 

In 2017, the enemies on the third floor received a webtoon, viewable here: "Requiem For The Lost":/pools/16539

For a list of the enemies, see the [[List of Ragnarok Online Characters]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3225769
other_names: ROお絵かき生体工学研究所

title: trigram
body:
Eight diagrams used in Taoist cosmology to represent the fundamental principles of reality, seen as a range of eight interrelated concepts. Each consists of three lines, each line either "broken" or "unbroken," representing yin or yang, respectively. Due to their tripartite structure, they are often referred to as "trigrams" in English.

Most popularly used on [[Yakumo Yukari]]'s [[tabard]] on her [[Imperishable Night]] outfit, as well as [[Yagokoro Eirin]]'s dress.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20559401

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: niku_miku_(nankai)
body:
English "Meat Miku", an alternate design of [[Hatsune Miku]] by [[Nankai (nankai san)|]].

Her hair and necktie are made of raw meat, her sleeves are transparent like shrink wrap and instead of her arm tattoo she has a discount sticker.

She's sometimes referred to by the codename "2939" (2 = ni, 9 = ku).

title: desert_dilemma_(meme)
body:
A thirsty man crawling through a desert and making a decision between two destinations written on different signs. One destination is noticeably farther away while the other is much closer. However, the man in the original comic chooses the farther away option, often 21 miles or 25 miles, as opposed to the closer one. Meme creators recaption what's written on the signs, as well as replace the man or the background, to depict someone making a poor decision.

h4. Origin

* !asset #21290256: Original comic

* "KnowYourMeme: Desert Dilemma":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/desert-dilemma

title: quadfold
body:
An insanely difficult [[contortion]] position in which the performer starts by laying on their stomach and bending their back until their thighs are parallel (or at least almost parallel) to the ground, effectively creating a knot out of their body. A variation of this position includes bending the knees to compress the performer even further.

Due to the tremendous amount of [[flexible|flexibility]] required to perform this position, it has never been confirmed whether it is humanly possible or if anyone has ever managed to achieve it. As of now, the performance of the quadfold remains fictional.

h4. Examples

* !post #7541545

title: folded_back
body:
A [[contortion]] pose (or at least a part of it), in which the performer bends their back backwards and squeezes it tightly in such a way that their upper back is touching their [[ass]]. The performers torso consequently forms a sort of "C" shape.

title: zuihou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Zuihou (kancolle)|]]'s Kai Ni forms.

She obtained her second remodels with the February 21, 2018 update with Kai Ni and Kai Ni- B forms.

Clothing-wise, she changed little, a lattice-patterned strap connected to both sleeves being the only real noticable change. Gear-wise, she gained a flight deck apron (complete with a "Dzuho" imprint, her real-life identification mark), her "mysterious" back gear has been rebuilt as less mysterious armoring with AA guns attached and her quiver as her flight deck. She now wields a full sized yumi. Similarly to Zuikaku's own second remodels, Kai2 is distinguished as keeping her camouflage color scheme (her muneate gained some landing guidance stripes in the process) and Kai Ni- B reverts to her original red-white color scheme.

Stats-wise, Kai Ni is a significant upgrade from kai, complete with medium range; while Kai Ni- B is a more expansive remodel that sacrifices plane slots and evasion for a larger upgrade (including the highest max AA amongst Light Carriers), ASW capabilities (weaker than Taiyou) and Long range. Both remodels are available at level 80.

title: ukulele_apology_video_(meme)
body:
An infamous "apology" video posted by YouTuber Colleen Ballinger (formerly known by her online persona [[Miranda Sings]]) in June 28th 2023 in which she addresses the then-recent controversy revolving around her allegedly "engaging with young fans in inappropriate ways":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/colleen-ballinger-and-adam-mcintyre-controversy.

The video came weeks after YouTuber Adam McIntyre shared his experiences of Ballinger purportedly having age-inappropriate conversations with him and various other young children in a group chat. Ballinger's decision to deliver her apology in the form of a [[ukulele]] song drew the ire of many internet commentators that believed the format to be too lighthearted to address the serious allegations levied against her, as well as trivializing the matters, prompting widespread backlash in the following days.

h4. Origin

* !asset #21209267: The video and it's like/dislike ratio as of May 2024

h4. See also

* [[Logan Paul's apology (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Colleen Ballinger (Miranda Sings) Ukulele Apology Video":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/colleen-ballinger-miranda-sings-ukulele-apology-video
* "YouTube video":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ceKMnyMYIMo

title: tonari_no_seki-kun
body:
A 2010 slice-of-life comedy manga  by artist [[Morishige Takuma (morisiget)|]] later adapted into an anime in 2014. It features [[Seki Toshinari]] who is an eccentric highschool boy passes time coming up with strange games, jokes, pranks and the like to entertain himself during class, and [[Yokoi Rumi]], his female classmate, who sits at the desk next to him and reacts to his antics and attempts to reign him in. 

The manga has a 2020 spin-off called [[Tonari no Seki-kun Junior]] in which Rumi has grown up and had a child and engages in similar antics with her son (who's father is implied to likely be Seki).
 
h4. Characters

* [[Seki Toshinari]]
* [[Yokoi Rumi]]

h4. See also

* [[Tonari no Seki-kun Junior]]

title: playing_with_hair
body:
A character playing with either [[playing with own hair|their own hair]] or [[playing with another's hair|another's]] hair.

This is generally frivolous, playful, or meaningless behavior. For example they might be simply [[twirling hair|twirling]] or [[hair_flip|flipping]] a lock of hair, making a "[[hair mustache]]", or [[eating_hair|"eating"]], [[ruffling_hair|ruffling]], [[kissing_hair|kissing]] or [[smelling_hair|smelling]] their or another's hair.

If they are meaningfully working with their or another's hair for a concrete goal, instead use one of the following tags as appropriate:

* [[adjusting hair]]
* [[holding own hair]]
* [[tying hair]]
* [[brushing hair]]
* [[drying hair]]
* [[bunching hair]]
* [[cutting hair]]
* [[braiding hair]]
* [[washing hair]]
* [[brushing hair]]

title: rainbow_mika
body:
[b]"Rainbow" Mika Nanakawa[/b], or [b]"Rainbow" Mika[/b] ([b]レインボー・ミカ[/b]) or [b]R. Mika[/b] for short, is a video game character from the [[Street Fighter]] fighting game series. Her first appearance is in [[street_fighter_zero_(series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]], later re-appearing in [[Street Fighter V]].

Mika is a Japanese [[wrestling|professional wrestler]] trained by the big, domineering, shinai-sporting, golf cart-riding [[Harmageddon Yoko]]. One of her favorite attacks (outside of grappling) is a flying [[hip attack]]. She is usually seen with her tag-team partner [[Yamato Nadeshiko (Street Fighter)|]]. She is considered the forefront representative of "joshipuro" (Japanese women's pro wrestling) in fighting games. [[Zangief]], a fellow pro wrestler, is her hero.

Mika is most commonly seen wearing a white and sky blue [[wrestling outfit]] of some design, complete with a [[domino mask]] serving as a [[wrestling mask]] around her [[blue eyes]] and her [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] done up as [[twintails]].

Mika's goal is to be "Star of the Ring." To try to accomplish this, Mika decided she would travel abroad and battle famous street fighters even before she made her official debut. During that time, she met Zangief, a wrestler she is a huge fan of. Zangief inspired her as a pro wrestler to train hard for the next time they meet.

title: workers'_party_of_korea_flag
body:
The [[flag]] of the Workers' Party of [[North Korea|Korea]] (shortened [b]WPK[/b]), the only ruling political party of North Korea. Use this tag when the flag and/or the logo is present in the image.

Its 3 symbols consist of a [[hammer]] (industrial workers), a short [[sickle]] (farmers) and the "samuwon" (a Korean [[calligraphy brush|ink brush]], used here to represent the clerks, traders, bureaucrats, professors, and writers).

h4. Examples

* !asset #23205893: WPK Flag: Logo against red background
* !asset #23205904: WPK Logo

title: hori-san_to_miyamura-kun
body:
Lit. [i]Hori-san and Miyamura-kun[/i]

A 4koma manga by [[hero_(dka)|HERO]], that was first published online in February 2007 and adapted into an OVA in 2011. The first bound volume was released in 2008 by Square Enix.

It was later adapted into [i]Horimiya[/i], a standard format manga by [[Hagiwara Daisuke]], serialized in Square Enix's [i]GFantasy[/i], which was later adapted into an anime by [[CloverWorks]] in Q1 2021.

[[Hori Kyouko]] is a flashy high school girl, who, despite her ostentatious appearance, excels in academics and has a family-loving character. [[Miyamura Izumi]] is a bland high school boy, who, despite not wanting to stand out in class, secretly wears piercings outside of school and has a large body tattoo. One day, Miyamura finds Hori's little brother injured and helps him back to Hori's house, where the relationship between Hori and Miyamura begins with Hori's discovery of Miyamura's secret.

h4. Characters

title: paper_bag
body:
A [[bag]] made out of recycled paper. Typically colored [[brown theme|brown]], and associated with [[shopping bag|shopping bags]], although they can be used as [[gift bag|gift bags]] as well.

Not to be confused with carrying bags that are actually [[brown bag|colored brown]].

title: a_second_plane_has_hit_the_x_(meme)
body:
[quote]
[i]"A second plane hit the second tower. America is under attack."[/i]
[/quote]
A [[meme]] based on a "photo":[https://rarehistoricalphotos.com/president-bush-informed-9-11-attack-photo] of [[George W. Bush]] being informed by White House Chief of Staff Andrew Card that a second plane had hit the [[World Trade Center]] on [[9/11]]. Bush was reading the children's book "The Pet Goat" in a classroom at the Emma E. Booker Elementary School in Sarasota, [[Florida (location)|]] when the photo was taken.

title: grim_(grim_adventures)
body: The Grim Reaper (or just Grim) is the titular main protagonist of the 2003 Cartoon Network animated TV series [[The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy]].

title: the_grim_adventures_of_billy_&_mandy
body: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy is an American animated television series created by Maxwell Atoms for [[Cartoon Network]]. It follows [[billy (grim adventures)|Billy]], an extremely dimwitted, happy-go-lucky boy, and [[mandy (grim adventures)|Mandy]], a cynical, remorseless girl, who, after winning a limbo game to save Billy's pet hamster, gains Grim, the mighty [[Grim Reaper]], as their "best friend forever". Grim, who is reluctant to serve the two children, has access to supernatural items, spells, and other abilities that often lead Billy and Mandy to interact with otherworldly environments, characters, or situations.
other_names: ヘクター・コンカルネ編

title: kozaky
body: A demonic mad scientist [[Duel Monster]]. Uses a Motorcycle-Rider deck in his [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]] appearance. The creator of the Koaki Meiru archetype and [[Giant Kozaky]]. He's also good with cybernetics, as he's the one who turned [[Gagagigo]] into Giga Gagagigo and turned Charcoal Inpachi into Woodborg Inpachi.

title: blunt_bangs
body:
A hairstyle where the [[bangs]] are cut in a sharp, straight line across the entire length of the forehead. Mutually exclusive with [[swept bangs]] and [[asymmetrical bangs]].

Known in Japan as パッツン ([i]pattsun[/i]).

When combined with [[long hair]] and blunt [[sidelocks]], it becomes a type of [[hime cut]]. If the bangs are shaved or combed back at the temples, with the rest hanging loose at the forehead it may result in [[center-flap bangs]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7096351
* !post #7546725
* !post #6486803

h4. See also

* [[arched bangs]]
* [[blunt ends]]
* [[bangs]]
* [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side
* [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs
** [[double-parted bangs]]
* [[asymmetrical bangs]] - For bangs worn half combed back, half loose
* [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead
* [[hair over eyes]] - For long bangs that cover the eyes
* [[hair over one eye]] - The same as the above, but asymmetric

title: berah_ronah
body:
Leader of the Crossbone Vanguard in [[Crossbone Gundam]].

[spoiler]The true identity of [[Cecily Fairchild]] as [[Carozzo Ronah]]'s daughter. She adopts her birth name after joining the [[Crossbone Vanguard]] following the events of [[Gundam F91]].[/spoiler]

title: blunt_tresses
body:
Hair that has been separated from the rest into [[sidelocks]], [[ringlets]], etc., and then been freshly cut flat. Typically tied with a [[tress ribbon]] or bunched together to create a tassel-like appearance. [[Akashi (kancolle)|Akashi]] from [[kantai collection|Kancolle]] is a prominent example of someone with these.

Not to be confused with [[blunt ends]], which refers to straight-cut hair in the back.

h4. Examples

* !post #8130294

h4. See also

* [[blunt bangs]]
* [[blunt ends]]

title: tress_ribbon
body:
A [[hair ribbon]] that is used only on a lock of hair. 

A "tress" is a long lock of hair, especially a long lock of women's hair. Archaically refers to a braid.

* !post #1415
* !post #1439697
* !post #3143459

* [[Ribbon braid]]

title: sagging_breasts
body:
When [[breasts]] have a noticeable sag to their shape, as opposed to the unnaturally perky breasts that are common in anime.

Not to be used for breasts that are simply [[hanging breasts|hanging]] freely due to the character [[bent over|bending over]] or [[leaning forward]].

Note that [[small breasts]] can also have a saggy appearance to them, although this is less common.

title: shibari
body:
A type of elaborate Japanese [[rope]] [[bondage]]. Common features of shibari include intricate criss-crossed rope patterns tied around the body, ropes tied to apply pressure to a woman's breasts, and [[crotch rope]]s.

[b]Shibari[/b] is Japanese for "to tie", originally an art of tying rope around objects in a visually appealing way. In modern times, shibari is now used to describe stylized bondage. In this case, it refers to any of a variety of intricate body ties originating in Japan.  

h4. Examples

title: frutiger_metro
body:
A visual aesthetic popular in the mid-late 2000s to early 2010s, and a derivative of [[Frutiger Aero]], mixing flat minimalist design styles with overall maximalist imagery.

Common visual elements include gradients, "bloom" or "flourish" shapes, glossy textures, [[bokeh]], [[abstract background]]s, [[splatter]] effects, [[no lineart|lineless]] vector drawings, shapes such as [[star (symbol)|]]s and circles, and [[silhouette]]s. Bright color palettes consisting mainly of lime green, electric blue, hot pink and neon orange are a staple.

Common thematic elements and motifs include nature imagery similar to Frutiger Aero, [[animal]]s like [[bird]]s and [[butterfly|butterflies]], [[speaker]]s and [[audio visualizer]]s, [[flower|floral]] imagery, and music motifs such as [[piano keys]] and [[musical note]]s.

It derives its name from the "Metro" theme of [[Windows 8]].

h4. Examples
* !post #235300
* !post #6575582
* !post #336426
* !post #1080628

h4. External links
* "Frutiger Metro":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Frutiger_Metro on Aesthetics Wiki

title: sparkle
body:
A momentary bright shimmer of reflected [[light]], generally [[diamond_(shape)|]]- or [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped, and short-lived. Groups of them tend to appear and vanish in various instances.

[b]Sparkle[/b], [[glint]], and [[diffraction spikes]] all refer to similar patterns of bright lines radiating from a point. They are not clearly differentiated, and usage tends to be context-sensitive. In general:
* [b]Sparkle[/b] is considered the base case. Usually four lines at right angles radiating from a point. Associated with eyes, liquid or particulate matter (e.g. raindrops, snow, sand), or nothing (appearing mid-air). Can appear in large numbers.
* [[Glint]] is associated with solid objects, especially ones which are metallic and/or sharp. Usually appear singly or in small numbers.
* [[Diffraction spikes]] is the technical term for the phenomenon in general, but is used less often. Can be used for more realistic-looking effects or conversely when appearing extremely large and exaggerated. More likely than sparkle and glint to be asymmetric or to have more than four radiating lines.

h4. See also

* [[sparkling aura]] for multiple sparkles around a certain object or character. 
* [[iridescent]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[bokeh]]
* [[light particles]]

title: pixel_art
body:
An image drawn with a pixelated art style, typically with large individual pixels and a limited color palette.

This may be either intentional or as a restriction by the software used to create it. This is common in older GIF images as well as images meant to invoke game [[sprite]]s.

Different from [[oekaki]], which has less emphasis on being drawn with individual pixels.

h4. Examples

* !post #5309196: [[Oekaki]]

title: maple_syrup
body:
A type of [[syrup]] made from the sap of maple trees. Popularly poured on [[pancake]]s and [[waffle]]s, and often associated with [[Canada]] due to the syrup being first made by the indigenous peoples of North America. The maple trees need to grow in colder climates for them to produce the sap, and Canada is the northernmost country of the continent, along with the [[maple leaf]] being seen on the [[Canadian flag]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: male_swimwear_challenge
body:
Art challenge where a female character is made to wear [[male swimwear]], either [[jammers]] or [[swim trunks]], while also [[topless]] and in a public space such as a [[beach]] or [[pool]]. [[reverse trap|Works best]] with an [[androgynous]]-looking [[short_hair|short-haired]] female character with a [[tomboy|boyish]] haircut and a [[flat chest]] or [[small breasts]], but art featuring obviously female characters with longer hair and/or larger busts can also suffice, possibly for definite titillation of the viewer and [[embarrassed|embarrassment]] for the subject. [[tomboy|Tomboys]] are frequently used as subjects to emphasize their masculine personalities.

While art of girls in male swimwear have been around for quite some time, the first direct response to the challenge appears to have been from November 21, 2020 on Twitter and Pixiv with post #4212758 (originally uploaded to Pixiv on the said date).

This tag can only be applied for direct art responses uploaded on Twitter or any art site on or after November 21, 2020. While the "男水着チャレンジ" tag is also being retroactively added to art uploaded prior to the said date on Pixiv, Nico Nico, and the like which appear to follow the concept, it is discouraged to do so here since it is highly likely the retroactive tag additions in said art sites are just mere afterthoughts.

h4. See also

* [[crossdressing]]
* [[exhibitionism]]

title: honey
body:
A sweet substance that is exclusively produced by [[bee|honey bees]] using nectar from flowers. It is widely used for sweetening foods, for flavoring, and for medicinal properties. 

Honey is one of the few foods in the world that in its raw state will never spoil if properly stored, this is due to honey's low water content, high acidity, and it containing small amounts hydrogen peroxide.

h4.See also

* [[Honeypot]]
* [[Honey dipper]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: owl
body:
A nocturnal [[bird]] of prey from the order "Strigiformes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owl]. About a third of all species have tufts of feathers on their heads colloquially known as "ears," which play no role in hearing but instead are used for display and communication.

h4. See also

title: air_jordan
body:
Air Jordan is an American sportswear brand owned by [[Nike (company)|]], originally created in collaboration with [[Michael Jordan]]. The line first launched in 1984, with the first release of the [[Air Jordan 1]] basketball [[sneakers|sneaker]], and has since expanded to feature a new numbered sneaker model every year, as well as other kinds of apparel and accessories.

Rereleases of numbered models are given the "Retro" subtitle, but otherwise retain the same design as their original releases.

title: no_bitches?_(meme)
body:
A meme spawned from a screenshot from the film [[megamind_(movie)|Megamind]], in which the [[megamind|titular character]] glares into a peephole with an expectant expression. In 2021, it was paired with the phrase "no bitches?", implying the viewer's status of having no lovers to call upon is something that disappoints Megamind greatly.

The trend of drawing different characters with the expression arguably began with [[monotone ink]]'s "version":[/posts/5150477], depicting [[melina (elden ring) |Melina]] from the at-the-time recently released [[Elden Ring]].

The panel features [[Gojou Satoru]] saying the phrase "Nah, I'd win." as a callback to his response when [[Itadori Yuuji]] asked him if he would lose against [[Ryoumen Sukuna (Jujutsu Kaisen)|Ryoumen Sukuna]] in Chapter 3. The panel exploded in popularity in late 2023 after Chapter 236 released because [spoiler]he would, in fact, not win.[/spoiler]

title: ultra_sword_kirby
body:
One of the Super Abilities used by [[Kirby]] in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]] and its [[kirby's return to dream land deluxe|remake]].
It also appears in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series as a [[Final Smash]].

It allows Kirby to use a [[huge_weapon|large sword]] in the form of the titular [[ultra sword]], or a similar object to defeat enemies and destroy certain parts of the terrain. 

Multiple variations can appear:
* a sword with a [[star (symbol)|]] on its handle (the aforementioned titular ultra sword)
* a [[shinai]]
* [[Meta Knight]]'s [[Galaxia (sword)|]]
* a [[cleaver]]
* a golden [[hand fan]]
* a [[cutlass]]
* a [[tuna]]
* [[Gigant Edge]]'s sword (introduced in the remake)
* [[Morpho Knight]]'s sword (introduced in the remake)

h4. External links
* "WiKirby: Ultra Sword":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Ultra_Sword

title: japan-korea_yuri_(meme)
body:
A chain of popular tweets began with Japanese and Korean women warning each other about the dangers of dating men from their respective countries and commiserating.  When one user suggested that "Japanese and Korean women should just date each other,":https://x.com/aupfmvv/status/1826826493559013716 artists quickly began to draw Korean woman x Japanese woman [[yuri]].  

The "Korean woman" is typically drawn with black hair and very confident and assertive, while the "Japanese woman" is typically drawn as a brown-haired, nervous, blushing mess.  Sometimes a Chinese woman gets thrown in as well (e.g. post #8047719, post #8048076).

Some Japanese women have tweeted stories about dating or flirting with Korean women (and vice versa) which have been drawn (e.g. post #8048084, post #8048092).

Since becoming popular, it has also spawned spinoffs involving other countries.

title: ciel_phantomhive
body:
The protagonist of [[Kuroshitsuji]].
The young heir and the son of the late Phantomhive household. He makes a contract with a [[Sebastian Michaelis|demon]] in exchange for his life and escape from a cult sacrifice, and henceforth becomes a pragmatic and cool operator. 

[spoiler] His name isn't actually Ciel. That was his older twin brother's name, and this Ciel usurped his identity after the former was sacrificed. [/spoiler]

title: x-wing
body:
A catchall for the [[T-65 X-wing]] and later [[T-70 X-wing]] starfighters used by the Rebel Alliance and Resistance respectively in the [[Star Wars]] series.
It made its theatrical debut, as the T-65B model, in [[star wars: a new hope|Star Wars (1977)]] as the spacecraft piloted by [[Luke Skywalker]] and the Red Squadron when Luke destroyed the [[Death Star]].

title: mostima_(arknights)
body:
[i]Mostima, Senior Messenger, will lay low all obstacles in your path with her Arts.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]December 12[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]170 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A messenger employee of [[penguin_logistics_(arknights)|Penguin Logistics]] who always acts alone. Nothing is known about her previous work history before joining Penguin Logistics. She was sent to Rhodes Island as a liaison for Penguin Logistics, where she assists with a variety of operations. She uses two staves as her choice of weapons, named "Black Lock" and "White Key" which she uses to slow the nervous system of her enemies, making it feel like she's stopping time.

[spoilers]Her motif is based on fallen angels, which is related to a tragic incident in her past. Her callsign itself is a reference to Mastema, who was a fallen angel in Judaism.[/spoilers]

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mizuki Nana]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3764712: Default
* !post #3764714: Elite II
* !post #5601086: Sports
* !post #3991905: [[Mostima (Spellbreaker) (Arknights)|Spellbreaker]]

title: iphone
body:
A line of [[smartphone]]s created by [[Apple Inc.]] using Apple's [[iOS (os)|]] operating system. The first-generation iPhone was announced by [[Steve Jobs]] on January 9, 2007. Since then Apple has annually released new iPhone models and iOS updates.

If it's tablet-sized, it's an [[iPad]]. It might also be an [[iPod Touch]].

Anything that looks like a smartphone with a circular home button is probably an iPhone.
iPhone 5 and later have the headphone jack on the bottom of the device instead of the top, like an [[iPod touch]].
iPhone 7 and later have no headphone jack.
[[iPhone X]] and later have no home button.

h4. Tagged Models

* [[iPhone (first generation)]]
* [[iPhone 3G]]
* [[iPhone 5s]]
* [[iPhone X]]
* [[iPhone XR]]
* [[iPhone 11]]
* [[iPhone 11 Pro]]
* [[iPhone 12]]
* [[iPhone 12 Pro]]

title: the_fast_and_the_furious:_tokyo_drift
body:
The third film in [[Fast & Furious]] saga, released in 2006. The film follows [[Sean Boswell]], a hot-headed American high schooler who gets sent to live with his father in [[Tokyo (city)|]] after a street racing wreck, and discovers the local [[drifting]] scene.

Tokyo Drift is largely credited for creating an increased interest in drifting and Japanese cars in America, and the movie's theme song (performed by Japanese rap group Teriyaki Boyz) is often used in [[meme]]s and edits about drifting to this day. Notable cars featured in the film include [[Han Lue|Han]]'s [[Veilside]] [[mazda rx-7 fd|FD RX-7]], Sean's [[Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution]], and the "Mona Lisa" [[Nissan Silvia S15]]. The film is also notable for real life drift legend [[Tsuchiya Keiichi]]'s involvement, as he was the stunt coordinator and one of the stunt drivers.

This entry is known as [b]Wild Speed X3 Tokyo Drift[/b] in Japan.

title: initial_d
body:

title: nissan_silvia_s14
body: The 6th generation of the [[Nissan Silvia]], sold from 1993-1998 in Japan and 1994-2000 in foreign markets. Sold as the Nissan 240SX in America.

title: nissan_onevia
body:
A custom version of the [[Nissan Silvia S13]] which replaces the front end with that of a [[Nissan 180SX]], essentially forming the inverse of the more popular [[Nissan Sileighty]] and replicating the appearance of the US market's S13 240SX.

Unlike the Sileighty, the Onevia custom model has never been officially recognized by Nissan.

title: nissan_silvia_s13
body:
The fifth generation of the [[Nissan Silvia]], produced from 1988 to 1994. It shared a platform with the [[Nissan 180sx|180SX]], which led to popular modifications like the [[Nissan Sileighty|Sileighty]] and [[Nissan Onevia|Onevia]], which swapped parts of the two models.

The S13 was sold in America as the 240SX, though it featured the 180SX's front end with pop-up headlights instead of the original Silva front-end.

title: nissan_silvia_s12
body: The fourth generation of the [[Nissan Silvia]], produced from 1983 to 1988. Known as the [b]Nissan 200SX[/b] in the US and the [b]Nissan Gazelle[/b] in Australia.

title: opa-opa
body:
[b]Opa-Opa[/b] is a fictional sentient [[robot]] /[[spacecraft]] [[mecha]] from the [[Fantasy Zone]] [[video game]] series by [[SEGA]] Corporation.

It is a small egg-shaped robot ship with two legs and wings. Its form resembles a [[chibi|superdeformed]] mecha in [[Gerwalk]] mode.

Opa-Opa became [[Sega]]'s mascot from 1985 until 1987, when it was replaced by [[Alex Kidd (character)|]].

He also appears in the anime [[Akai Koudan Zillion]] and its [[video game]] adaptations for the [[Sega Master System]] [[game console]].

title: e-100
body:
A prototype German superheavy tank, intended to be a more standardized version of the Maus. Only its hull was ever completed, though a proposal for its turret existed but failed to materialize. It was supposed to be the largest and most powerful tank in the E-Series, armed with a 128mm gun.

body:
A platformer battle royale game developed by Mediatonic and published by Devolver Digital, released for [[computer|PC]] and [[PlayStation 4]] in 2020. title: tenugui
body: A flat-woven Japanese cotton fabric. Traditionally used as a multipurpose cloth, whereas in contemporary Japan terrycloth has become more commonplace for any other practical use. It is still used for decorative purposes or for apparel such as [[headscarf|head scarves]].

body:
A [[boar]] from the [[Animal Crossing]] franchise. She visits the player's island every Sunday to sell [[Turnip]]s. Her role is replaced by her granddaughter [[Daisy Mae (animal crossing)|]] in [i]New Horizons[/i].
She wears a [[blue kimono|blue]] [[kimono]] with an [[igeta (pattern)|]] pattern, a white [[headscarf]], and carries a [[basket]] of turnips on her back. She has a pair of white tusks and her pupils are shaped like [[star-shaped pupils|stars]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[antenna_hair|antennas]]. She often wears a [[side ponytail]] and a [[headscarf]] with [[floral print|sakura print]].

According to comment #3313302, [[jotti]]’s silver-haired girl with blue eyes is her [[futanari]] [[wife_and_wife|wife]] (they sometimes wear [[wedding ring|wedding bands]]) and the silver-haired girl with red eyes might be their daughter.

title: scarf
body:
A garment that consists of a thin cloth far longer than it is wide. The actual length tends to vary. The garment is typically worn wrapped around the neck during the fall or winter when it is cold out.

Known to be worn by ninjas as a sort of trademark.

He is famous as the winner of the 2013 Kikuka Sho and the 2014 Japan Cup. He is also famous as a successful sire in his own right, being the sire of a Triple Tiara with [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]].

body: A playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]; her full name is Barbara Pegg. [quote]"The Deaconess of the Favonius Church and a shining starlet adored by all. Although the concept of a starlet is rather novel in a city of bards, the people of Mondstadt love Barbara nonetheless."[/quote] Barbara has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], styled into [[twin drills]]. She wears a [[white dress]] with a [[detached collar]], as well as [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[puffy long sleeves|puffy sleeves]]. For legwear, she wears [[white pantyhose]] and [[fold-over boots]]. Her older sister is [[Jean (Genshin Impact)|Jean]], the Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius. She is voiced by [[Kitou Akari]] (Japanese) and [[Laura Stahl]] (English). h4. title: ultraman_zero_beyond
body:
Ultraman Zero Beyond is a form featured in [[Ultraman Geed (series)|]] that is accessed through the Riser (Zero Mode) which uses assets of the New Generation Ultra Warriors ([[Ultraman Ginga|Ginga]], [[Ultraman Victory|Victory]], [[Ultraman X|X]], and [[Ultraman Orb|Orb]]). It is stated to be [[Ultraman Zero|Zero]]'s most powerful form. This form debuts in episode 8.

In this form, Zero traded his Protector for Crystals shaped after Orb's Protectors and his face resembles the Riser (Zero Mode).

In Ultraman Hit Song History New Generation, rather than a Fusion Rise, Zero is able to achieve this form by physically fusing with its four components. It is unknown whether this version of Zero Beyond is any more powerful than the normal one.

title: chuseok
body:
Chuseok , also known as Hangawi (from archaic Korean for "the great middle (of autumn)"), is a major mid-autumn harvest festival and a three-day holiday in South Korea celebrated on the 15th day of the 8th month of the lunar calendar on the full moon. In North Korea, they only celebrate for the day of chuseok. Like many other harvest festivals around the world, it is held around the autumn equinox, i.e. at the very end of summer or in early autumn. It is the biggest traditional holiday in South Korea.

h4. See also

* [[Mid-Autumn Festival]] [tn]Chinese equivalent[/tn]
* [[Tsukimi]] [tn]Japanese equivalent[/tn]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Chuseok":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuseok

title: james_earl_jones
body:
James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 – September 9, 2024) was an American actor. A pioneer for black actors in the entertainment industry, he is known for his extensive and acclaimed roles on stage and screen. He is one of the few performers to achieve the EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony).
Jones made his film debut in [[Stanley Kubrick|Stanley Kubrick's]] [[Dr. Strangelove]] (1964). He received a Golden Globe Award nomination for Claudine (1974). Jones gained international fame for his voice role as [[Darth Vader]] in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, beginning with the original 1977 film. Jones's other notable films include The Man (1972), [[Conan the Barbarian]] (1982), and [[The Lion King]] (1994).

title: date_pun
body:
A [[number pun]] based on a particular date.

November is notorious for having a lot of these because "11" resembles イイ (good/great). For example, November 29th is "[[good meat day]]" (ii niku no hi) because two (ni) and nine (ku) sounds like meat (niku).

title: higanbana_no_saku_yoru_ni
body:
彼岸花の咲く夜に, lit. [i]On the Night the Red [[Spider Lily]] Blooms[/i]

A visual novel and 2010-2012 manga by [[Ryuukishi07]] and 07th Expansion of [i][[Higurashi no Naku Koro ni]][/i] and [i][[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]][/i], with illustrations by Tsunohazu Ichirou, serialized in Fujimi Shobo's [i]Monthly Dragon Age[/i]. 

It originally began as [i]Gakkou Youkai Kikou: Dai-hachi Kaidan Boshuuchuu[/i] (学校妖怪紀行 第八怪談募集中), lit. [i]School Youkai Traveler's Guide: Recruiting the Eighth Kaidan[/i], a 2007 light novel serialized in Fujimi Shobo's [i]Dragon Age Pure[/i], with illustrations by [[Nishieda]], which ran for three chapters before being discontinued. 

It was then followed by the manga [i]Gakkou Youkai Kikou - You[/i] (学校妖怪紀行 ~葉~), with illustrations by [[Izumi Rei]], which was also serialized in [i]Dragon Age Pure[/i] in 2007 before ending after two chapters.

title: greyscale
body:
A completely colorless, black-and-white image. The image is composed exclusively of shades of black, white, and grey. It is very common for [[comic]]s and [[doujinshi]] to be in greyscale.

The image may have small highlights of color (known as [[spot color]]s), but the image as a whole should be predominately greyscale.

Don't use color tags like [[black eyes]] or [[black hair]] when tagging greyscale images. The exception is color background tags, so tagging [[white background]], [[grey background]], or [[black background]] is fine.

h4. Guidelines

* For completely colorless art, use [[greyscale]].
* For a post consisting of a single color that isn't grey, use [[monochrome]], not [[greyscale]].
* For a mostly greyscale post with a small amount of color as a highlight, use [[greyscale]] and [[spot color]].
* For a post using a mix of color and greyscale, use [[partially colored]], not [[greyscale]].
* For a colorless foreground and colorful background, use [[greyscale with colored background]], not [[greyscale]] or [[partially colored]].
* For a post that has solid black shadings, use [[greyscale]] and [[high contrast]].
* For posts with a small variety of colors but more than two actual colors, use [[limited palette]], not [[greyscale]] or [[monochrome]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5785450
* !post #5591560: [[Spot color]]

h4. Not greyscale

* !post #5653986: [[Monochrome]]
* !post #5761420: [[Sepia]]
* !post #5782023: [[Partially colored]]
* !post #6764762: [[Limited palette]]
* !post #3408688: [[Muted color]]

h4. See also

* [[greyscale with colored background]]
* [[high contrast]]
* [[lineart]]
* [[monochrome]]
* [[muted color]]
* [[partially colored]]
* [[sepia]]
* [[spot color]]
* [[Tag Group:Colors]]

title: sepia
body:
An image primarily colored or tinted in sepia, a brownish or yellowish color tone commonly seen in old photographs. This may be used to impart a vintage or antique quality, or to indicate something happened in the past, such as a flashback.

h4. Examples

* !post #5761420
* !post #5097739

h4. See also

* [[monochrome]]
* [[Tag group:Colors]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Photographic print toning: Sepia toning":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Photographic_print_toning#Sepia_toning]

title: high_contrast
body:
A picture that features very dark colors besides very light colors. More commonly seen on [[greyscale]] arts, but it can also be seen of coloful ones such as post #137122.

Try to look for broad ink-like strokes, pitch black shadowing, solid black and white.

These are often results of [[flat color]] (post #5538857) or [[comic|manga]]-like coloring (post #5782342), [[halftone]] may be present too (post #5892760). Compare post #5785450, which despite having very dark hair, has enough shading to give it more gradient and volume.

Not to be confused with [[spot color]] or [[color contrast]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7035965

h4. See also

* [[flat color]]
* [[Tag Group:Colors]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: hoshii_miki
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the Xbox 360 version of the original [i]Idolmaster[/i] game.
A dyed-blonde 14-year-old idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy" along with [[Ganaha Hibiki]] and [[Shijou Takane]], having defected from 765 Production (as of the DS game [i]Dearly Stars[/i]) due to her dissatisfaction with her handling. It is shown that Miki joins 765 Production, along with Hibiki and Takane, in the Idolmaster anime. Laid-back but brilliant, Miki is very popular with males, and believes in an easy way to becoming the top idol.


h4. Stats 

* Birthday: November 23
* Horoscope: Sagittarius ♐
* Age: 14 → 15
* Height: 159cm → 161cm 
* Weight: 44kg → 45kg 
* BMI: 17.4 → 17.3
* Measurements: 84-55-82 → 86-55-83 
* Cup size: F
* Blood Type: B 
* Hobbies: Bird watching, talking with friends → talking with friends, nail art
* Seiyuu: [[Hasegawa Akiko]] 
* Theme color: light green (fresh green)

h4. See Also

* [[Awakened Miki]] - A hard-working version of Miki with short, brown hair.

title: kikuchi_makoto
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series.
Honest, sensitive 16-year-old Makoto's [[reverse trap|boyish]] looks (having been raised as a boy by her father, who wanted one) and skill at sports pigeonholed her into becoming a "pretty-boy idol", much to her chagrin, having originally joined the studio in order to become more feminine.

Makoto's theme color is black, and she is voiced by [[Hirata Hiromi]].

* Age: 16 → 17
* Height: 157 cm → 159 cm
* Weight: 42 kg → 44 kg
* Birthday: August 29th
* Horoscope: Virgo ♍
* Blood type: O
* Three sizes: 73-56-76 → 75-57-78
* Hobbies: All sports, Collecting stuffed animals 
* Horoscope: Virgo
* Likes: Shoujo manga and mineral water
* Dislikes: Bugs and sports drinks
* Writing Hand: Right

title: critter_pick_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A [[Honkai: Star Rail]] event that features various critters that look like [[cat]]s fused with [[mooncake]]s; a lot of which are based of pre-existing characters. They were originally created by [[Ruan Mei (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei]].

(This tag is intended for the critters themselves, but as they are not collectively named beyond simply being called "Ruan Mei's Creations" (a term shared with another species of critters resembling dumplings), the tag takes its name after the event for the time being. It should likely be renamed once their species name is clarified)

title: divided_highway
body:
A divided highway (NA) or dual carriageway (UK) is a [[highway]] with a divider between the lanes going in opposite directions.  This divider may be a physical barrier, such as a strip of land or a concrete barrier, or it might be an empty lane with clear markings to indicate it's a divider (typically found only in rural areas with low traffic).

h4. See also

* [[Elevated highway]]
* [[Multi-lane road]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dual carriageway":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dual_carriageway]

title: thobe
body:
Thawb or thobe (Arabic: ثَوْب) is an [[Arabian clothes|Arab]] men's garment. It is a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] ankle-length traditional [[robe]]—often light-colored. It is mainly worn in the Arabian Peninsula, the Levant, North Africa, and some countries in East and West Africa.

title: cooler_(dragon_ball)
body:
[[Dragon Ball Z]] villain from Movie 5. [[Frieza]]'s older brother. As opposed to his brother, he has a [[cooler (fifth form) (dragon ball)|unique final transformation]]. He later returns in his movie's sequel in another form, [[Meta-Cooler]].

In charge of [[Cooler's Armored Squadron]], which is composed of [[Salza]], [[Doore]], and [[Neiz]].

title: cooler_(fifth_form)_(dragon_ball)
body:
[[Cooler (Dragon Ball)|]]'s exclusive form, first appearing in [[Dragon Ball Z]] Movie 5, also known as [b]Fourth Transformation[/b] (第４変身) and Cooler's Final Form. Unlike the previous forms in the [[Frieza Clan]] (which either suppress their power of their real form, or is their real form in their Fourth and usually Final Form), his Fifth Form was a power-up similar to the [[Super Saiyan]] forms. The body changes include a growth in height, gaining spike protrusions and additional gem-like parts, natural [[red eyes]] becoming fully colored and [[no pupils|pupil-less]], and the inclusion of a [[mouth mask]].

In [[Dragon Ball Heroes]], Cooler would take advantage of his brother's [[Golden Frieza|Golden]] transformation and combine it with his fifth form to become [[Golden Cooler]].

title: iruma_miu
body:
Character from [i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i].

The Ultimate Inventor. Likes to experiment with new gadgets, but has disowned her most well known invention, "Eye-drop Contacts", after selling it off. She is a rude, crass girl until someone responds in turn, which causes her to back down almost immediately.

Wears a pink [[serafuku]] with [[goggles]] [[goggles_on_head|on her head]]. She wears a [[black choker]] and smaller [[barbed wire]] necklaces. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and a [[large_breasts|prominent bust]].

She is often depicted with a [[Niko Niko Happy]] mouse mascot.

body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Petra Gurin]]. 

Her default [[school uniform]] costume comprises a [[multicolored_clothes|multicolored]] [[white hoodie|white]] and [[black hoodie]] over a [[white shirt|all]]-[[white skirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with a [[yellow neckerchief]] [[neck ribbon|around her neck]]. She has a [[bird tail]] and wears a pair of [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[sneakers]]. Her hair is kept [[short hair|short]] and [[tied hair|tied]] into a [[folded ponytail]]. She also wears an [[arm belt]] over each of her [[long_sleeves|sleeve]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4647550: Profile
* !post #4827836: Reference sheet

title: petra_gurin
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber]], part of the second wave [[Obsydia (nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[momoko_(momopoco)|Momoco Haru]]. 

Petra is a [[blue eyes|blue-eyed]] [[penguin girl]] with a [[:3|catface]] as a default expression, [[short hair|short]], [[multicolored_hair|multicolored]] [[black hair]] with [[orange hair|orange]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] [[tied hair|tied]] into a [[folded ponytail]] and a [[fish hair ornament]].

h4. Costumes

h5. Official costumes with a model

* !post #4647550: [[Petra Gurin (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #5619823: [[Petra Gurin (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: "Combat Idol":[https://www.youtube.com/live/Azz606574xE?si=1QbYtO6fmX0zcPrI&t=2416]
* !post #6889024: [[Petra Gurin (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]: Zuttoღo Spring

h5. Costumes shared with other members

* !post #6932340: NijiFes: Group Green

h4. Personality

Despite her cutesy looks and meek personality, Petra is pretty foul-mouthed and known to curse profusely, especially during horror games. Her short stature and tendency to get frustrated easily led to her being labeled the "most bulliable member of EN" until [[Mysta Rias|Mysta]] took the title from her. She's very close with [[Reimu Endou]], having been friends with her long before NIJISANJI to the point where they refer to each other as their "wives," and she frequently interacts/is depicted in fanart with [[Shu Yamino]] due to their similar hairstyles, which has led to them being known as the "penguin siblings."

h4. Nijisanji units and groups

* [[Obsydia (Nijisanji)|]] (debut)
* [[Zuttomo (Nijisanji)|Zuttoღo/NijiUK]] (casual)

h4. See also

* [[Pentomo (Petra Gurin)|]] (fanbase and mascot)
* [[Peter Gurin]], the [[genderswap (ftm)|genderswapped]] version of Petra
* [[Petra Gurin (artist)]] for works made by her.

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":[https://www.youtube.com/@petragurin]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Petra_Gurin]
* "Nijisanji Unofficial Wiki article":[https://wikiwiki.jp/nijisanji/Petra%20Gurin]

title: five_nights_at_freddy's
body:
[b]Five Nights at Freddy's[/b], abbreviated as [b]FNAF[/b] , is a series of indie survival horror game series made by Scott Cawthon in which the player must protect themselves from hostile animatronics. The first game featured initially [[Freddy Fazbear]], [[Bonnie (fnaf)|]], [[Chica]] and [[Foxy (fnaf)|]], with further games including entirely new animatronics and variations of the existing ones.

h4. Games
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 1]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 2]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 3]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's 4]]
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's: Sister Location]] (5)
* [[Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria Simulator]] (6)
* Ultimate Custom Night
* Five Nights at Freddy's VR: Help Wanted
* Five Nights at Freddy's AR: Special Delivery
* [[Five Nights at Freddy's: Security Breach]]

h6. Spin-offs
* [[FNAF World]]
* Freddy in Space 2
* Five Nights at Freddy's: Into the Pit

h6. Fazbear Fanverse Initiative

* Five Nights at Freddy's High School also FNAFHS

title: korea_train_express

Korea Train eXpress (Korean: 한국고속철도), often known as KTX (Korean: 케이티엑스; RR: Keitiekseu), is South Korea's high-speed rail system, operated by Korail. Construction began on the high-speed line from Seoul to Busan in 1992. KTX services were launched on April 1, 2004.

title: tangzhuang
body:
A [b]tangzhuang[/b] (Simplified Chinese: 唐装) is a kind of pseudo-traditional Chinese [[jacket]], typically with a [[mandarin collar]] .

It originated at the end of the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911) as an evolution of the Manchurian [i]magua[/i], which had been adopted by the Han Chinese during the [[Qing Dynasty]]. At that time, only noblemen, aristocracy and government officials wore it, however, in modern times it was eventually adopted by common people. This kind of clothing is often seen as a national costume for men, although women wear it as well. 

[[Saotome Ranma]] from [[Ranma 1/2]] is usually seen wearing this type of jacket.

h4. See also

* [[chinese clothes]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tangzhuang":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tangzhuang]
* "GBTimes: The tang suit and its Qing Dynasty origins":[https://gbtimes.com/tang-suit-and-its-qing-dynasty-origins]

body:
A female Erune from [[Granblue Fantasy]]. She has a beret with her ears hidden underneath(usually), black thighhighs and open toed footwear, very long grey hair with blunt bangs and multiple braids, has heterochromia with one red and one green eye, wears a red dress and skirt with an obi and detached sleeves.

She is often seen with her companion wolf [[hakutaku_(granblue_fantasy)|Hakutaku]].

title: haguro_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Haguro[/i]. Character design by [[Ootsuki Momiji]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[side ponytail]], and [[red eyes]]. In line with the class being portrayed as schoolgirls, she wears a black [[serafuku]] [[crop top]] and a long [[black skirt]]. She also wears black [[platform boots]], [[black belt]], [[mismatched legwear]] where it is a [[single kneehigh]] on her right and [[fishnet socks|fishnet]] on her left, [[black choker]], a crow [[mask]], and torn [[black gloves]].

Her rigging consists of four out of five historical 203 mm twin mounts on two separate hull pieces, one mount of 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left, and a [[tantou]] sidearm.

title: kamen_rider_black_rx
body:
Hero of [[Kamen Rider BLACK RX (series)|]], a child of the sun.

Black RX is the result of [[Minami Koutarou]]'s Kingstone mutating from exposure to solar radiation after being thrown into space. With his new powers, he returns to Earth to put an end to the Crisis Empire.

RX retains the grasshopper motif and is now colored black and green. His new powers allow him to switch between the yellow [[Roborider]] and blue [[Biorider]].

title: bad_omens_(band)
body:
Bad Omens is an American Metalcore band formed in 2015 who bears artistic influence from [[Bring Me The Horizon]] [i]et al,[/i] according to an interview in 2016 by Alternative Press. The band rose to popularity with their 2022 song "Just Pretend" from their album "The Death of Peace of Mind". Currently consists of frontman & lead vocalist Noah Sebastian; bassist Nicholas Ruffilo; guitarist, programmer & backing vocalist Joakim Karlsson and drummer Nick Folio, the band received positive recognition by Bring Me The Horizon and became the supporting act in the latter's tour in January 2024.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bad Omens":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Omens

title: power_rangers_hyperforce
body:
A tabletop RPG launched as part of [[Power Rangers]]' 25th anniversary. It is streamed live by Hyper RPG on popular video game streaming platform Twitch.

Set in the year 3016 at Time Force Academy, a team of Time Force Ranger cadets must band together to defeat an ancient evil who is set on unraveling the very fabric of the universe. Under the leadership of their mentor, [b]Jen Scotts[/b], and with the show’s Game Master, Malika Lim, the newly minted Rangers will cross both time and space to complete their mission while running into many familiar eras (and faces) along the way.

title: bird_of_paradise_flower
body:
[i][b]Strelitzia[/b][/i] (commonly known as bird of paradise or crane flower) is a genus of five flowering plants in the family [i]Strelitziaceae[/i] native to the southern Africa. Its common name, [i]bird of paradise[/i], refers to the resemblance of the open flower to the head of an actual [[bird of paradise (bird)|]].

Bird of paradise produces exotic looking flowers, usually in shades of red, orange or yellow ([i]Strelitzia reginae[/i], [i]S. juncea[/i]), although some species are white ([i]Strelitzia alba[/i], [i]S. caudata[/i], [i]S. nicolai[/i]). Each flower sprouts from a beak-like sheath (called a spathe) that grows at right angles to the stem, creating the appearance of the bird's beak. The flowers consist of red to yellow sepals and purplish-blue or white petals. The leaves are tall and thick, arranged in a fan-like pattern.

h4. Examples
* !asset #21573012: Photo reference
* !asset #21572458
* !post #4215027

h4. See also
* [[Heliconia]], also known as [i]false bird of paradise[/i]
* [[Red ginger (flower)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Strelitzia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strelitzia
* "Wikipedia: Strelitzia reginae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strelitzia_reginae
* "Wikipedia: Strelitziaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strelitziaceae

title: bring_me_the_horizon
body:
Bring Me the Horizon (often abbreviated as BMTH) are a British rock band formed in Sheffield in 2004. The band is best known for their metalcore songs and their influence on the subgenre, although the band started out as a deathcore band with the release of their debut EP "This Is What The Edge Of Your Seat Was Made For" and debut album "Count Your Blessings"; and delved into nu-metal with the release of their sixth album "[[Amo (bring me the horizon)|]]", and returned to their aggressive roots with their EP "Post Human: Nex Gen", surprise-released on 24th May 2024. The band has collaborated with numerous other acts such as Lights, Ed Sheeran, SLANDER, Spiritbox, AURORA, Underoath and so on, and had won many awards including [i]Kerrang![/i] Awards, BRIT Awards, Alternative Press and nominated for Grammy Awards on various categories.

In the end of 2023, the band announced one of their member Jordan Fish leaving the band. Fish first worked with the band to assist the existing members to complete the band's fourth album "Sempiternal", with his notable work being "Can You Feel My Heart":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJJYpsA5tv8] from the album been widely used in the [[gigachad_(meme)|]] [[meme]]. The song became the most well-known song of the band as the result of the meme.

h4. References

* "Wikipedia: Bring Me The Horizon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bring_Me_the_Horizon]
* "[i]Kerrang![/i]: Bring Me The Horizon Part Ways with Jordan Fish":[https://www.kerrang.com/amp/bring-me-the-horizon-part-ways-with-jordan-fish]
* "KnowYourMeme: Gigachad":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/gigachad]
