title: power_rangers:_legacy_wars
body:
Power Rangers: Legacy Wars is a mobile video game released to tie-in to the 2017 movie. Power Rangers Legacy Wars is a cross-series mashup of various Ranger teams, villains and monsters where players can team up with or battle other users online. It was announced at San Diego Comic Con in July 2017 that the app had surpassed 18 million downloads.

Beginning with an update on May 17th 2018, characters from the [[Street Fighter]] franchise are incorporated into the game.

On July 19th, a teaser trailer for a short movie called Power Rangers Legacy Wars - Street Fighter Showdown was released celebrating the two franchises and the release of the brand new fusion Ranger "[[Crimson Hawk Ranger]]".

title: daijinryuu
body:
A sentient mechanical dragon god that appears as a neutral antagonist in [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]].

His counterpart in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] is [b]Serpentera[/b], a giant personal Zord of [[Lord Zedd]], and is co-piloted by [[grifforzer|Goldar]].

It is the most massive Zord ever created; the skycraper-sized Red Dragon Thunderzord is roughly the size of its hand. It resembles an Eastern Dragon in form, and has enough power to annihilate a planet. It attacks by firing out bolts of energy, and its colossal size allows to crush nearly any foe, although Tor the Shuttlezord could withstand it, if only barely. Its massive power brought the Power Rangers to the brink of defeat every time that it was called, and it failed to destroy them only because of its one weakness: the colossal amount of fuel that it needed to be powered.

title: kidou_keisatsu_patlabor
body:
[i][b]Patlabor[/b][/i] (a portmanteau of "patrol" and "labor"), also known as [i][b]Mobile Police Patlabor[/b][/i] (機動警察パトレイバー), is an anime and manga [[science fiction]] franchise created in 1988 by "Headgear", a group consisting of manga artist [[Yuuki Masami]], director Oshii Mamoru, screenwriter Itō Kazunori, mecha designer [[Izubuchi Yutaka]], and character designer [[Takada Akemi]]. 

Patlabor is set in a near future [[Japan]], and it chronicles the exploits of a metropolitan [[police]] unit equipped with patrol [[mecha]]s called "Patlabors". 

The franchise includes a manga, a TV series, two OVA series, three feature-length movies, two light novel series, and a short film compilation, named [i][b]Minipato[/b][/i] (ミニパト) because of its [[chibi]] drawing style.

The original manga received the 36th Shogakukan Manga Award for shōnen in 1991.

h4. Characters

* [[AV-98 Ingram]]

title: shogo:_mobile_armor_division
body: [b]Shogo: Mobile Armor Division[/b] is a First Person Shooter PC game made and published by Monolith Productions in 1998. The game is heavily inspired by 1980s/1990s Mecha anime like [[Appleseed]] and [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]] as the player can pilot four different Mechs of your choice.

title: yumekawa_yui
body:
Protagonist of [[Idol Time Pripara]]. [[Yumekawa Shogo]]'s sister. As her name suggests, she is based on [[yume kawaii]].

Yui has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[curly hair|curls]], [[sidelocks]] and [[two side up]] [[ringlets]]. She decorates her hair with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow|bow]] with a [[star hair ornament|star]] in the middle and usually wears [[Avocado Academy school uniform]].

While inside PriPara, Yui grows taller and her hair [[long hair|reaches down until her waist]]. Her usual outfit consists of a [[purple choker|purple]] [[star choker]], a [[star necklace]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[pink jacket]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[purple shirt]] with a [[heart print|heart]] [[print shirt|print]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[purple skirt|purple]] [[miniskirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]] on the bottom, [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]] decorated with a [[pink bow]].

Alternate universe counterpart: [[Gekikawa Yui]] from [i][[Kiratto Pri Chan]][/i] of [[Pretty Series|the same franchise]].

Voiced by Date Arisa.

title: distortion_(project_moon)
body:
[WIP]
Distortion is a recurring phenomena in [[Project Moon]] media, first introduced in [[Library Of Ruina]] before being expanded upon in [[The Distortion Detective]] and [[Limbus Company]].

Distortion is primarily caused when an individual communicates with the Voice ([spoiler][[Carmen (project moon)|]][/spoiler]) and accepts their offer rather than reject them. 

Distortion causes an individual to change into a distorted/monstrous version of themselves, which is usually permanent but can be reversed. One may even manifest [[E.G.O (project moon)|]] after distorting, or vice versa.

title: argalia_(project_moon)
body:
Antagonist from [[Library of Ruina]].

[[Roland (project moon)|]]'s brother-in-law and [[Angelica (project moon)|]]'s brother.
He has long flowing [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears a [[blue cape]] and [[blue jacket|jacket]] with [[black pants]] and [[white gloves]], most of these clothes [[gold trim]]med.

Carries a [[scythe]] as his weapon.

[spoiler]In his [[Distortion (project moon)|Distorted]] form, his head resembles a cloud with one big eye.
He's often drawn resembling a small one-eyed cloud or animal in this form (post #6975221).[/spoiler]

title: maris_amaryllis
body:
[[Lia Parapara Leazas]]' personal handmaiden, and the secondary antagonist of [[Rance I]] and [[Rance 01|its remake]].

Despite her seemingly low station, Maris secretly handles many of Lia's more private affairs, acting almost as much of a ruler as Lia herself. She is so undyingly loyal to her queen that many believe she has romantic feelings for Lia.

[i]Skyfire, Operator from King's Wand, is ready to burn anyone foolish enough to stand in her way.[/i]

title: milli_yorks
body:
Character from the [[Rance (series)|Rance Series]], introduced in [[Rance II]].

A woman with an unsatiable desire for sex, Milli is a mature, risque adventurer who makes no distinction between man or woman - both are gorgeous in her eyes. She's also [[Mill Yorks]]' older sister.

Needless to say, she gets along greatly with [[Rance]], who are both sex addicts.

title: leila_grecny
body:
Character from the [[Rance (series)|Rance Series]], introduced in [[Rance III]].

The captain of the Leazas Royal Guard, Leila is a talented swordswoman, second only to [[Rick Addison]], whom Leila has romantic feelings for. She's also close friends with [[Yulang Mirage]], and has tried unsuccessfully to convince her to join the Royal Guard.

title: tamagotchi
body:
A franchise of handheld "digital pet" devices released by [[Bandai]] in 1996. The [[tamagotchi (virtual pet)|device]] is egg-shaped and can be held in one hand. 

On the screen of the device shows a pixelated "pet" that can be taken care of via the buttons surrounding the device. The pet can get hungry, sleep, get sick, play, misbehave, etc., and the player must respond to these behaviors of the pet (or else the pet dies). 

Pets often have lifecycles and may die of old age. Gameplay varies from device to device.

title: checkers_piece
body:
Checkers pieces are small circular discs used to play the [[board game]] of Checkers. They are typically black, red, or white. The board used is basically the same 8x8 grid format as a [[chessboard]].

title: the_room
body:
A 2003 drama film directed, written by and starring Tommy Wiseau.

It is about a banker (played by Tommy) discovering his fiancee has been cheating on him with his friend.

The film became a cult hit due to its "so bad, it's good" nature, often described as "the [i]Citizen Kane[/i] of bad movies".

title: google_stadia
body:
A defunct cloud gaming service developed and operated by [[Google]] for streaming video games to players via their servers.  Offered up 4K resolution at 60 frames per second with HDR support.

"After making the announcement in September":[https://web.archive.org/web/20230119014349/https://twitter.com/GoogleStadia/status/1575524318481879040], Stadia services ceased on January 18th, 2023, highlighting poor sales due to high network requirements. Their website now redirects to a ""gg":[https://stadia.google.com/gg/]" landing page.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Google Stadia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Stadia]

title: takahashi_shotei_(style)
body:
Takahashi Shotei (also known as Takahashi Hiroaki) was a Japanese ukiyo-e artist active in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
He is best known for his woodblock prints, which often depicted serene landscapes, nature scenes, and traditional Japanese settings.
Shotei was associated with the shin-hanga movement, which sought to revive traditional Japanese woodblock printing techniques while incorporating Western artistic influences.
His works are celebrated for their delicate use of color and fine details.

title: with_handala_pose
body: A pose taken from the popular cartoon character Handala (Arabic: حنظلة, romanized: Ḥanẓala), created in 1969 by the late [[Palestine|Palestinian]] cartoonist Naji al-Ali. A national symbol and personification of the Palestinian people, Handala is often depicted facing away with his hands behind his back. His pose represents defiance towards [[Israel]] over its occupation of both the West Bank and the [[Gaza|Gaza Strip]]. h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Handala":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handala]

title: star_wars:_revenge_of_the_sith
body:
[[Star Wars]]: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith is a 2005 American epic space opera film written and directed by [[George Lucas]]. It stars [[Ewan McGregor]], [[Natalie Portman]], [[Hayden Christensen]], Ian McDiarmid, [[Samuel L. Jackson]], [[Christopher Lee]], Anthony Daniels, Kenny Baker and Frank Oz. The sequel to [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace]] (1999) and [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones]] (2002), it is the sixth film in the Star Wars film series and the final installment in the Star Wars prequel trilogy.

Revenge of the Sith is set three years after the onset of the [[Star Wars:  the clone wars|Clone Wars]] as established in Attack of the Clones. The [[Jedi]] are spread across the galaxy in a full-scale war against the Separatists. The Jedi Council dispatches Jedi Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] on a mission to defeat [[General Grievous]], the head of the Separatist army and Count Dooku's former apprentice, to put an end to the war. Meanwhile, after having visions of his wife [[Padme Amidala]] dying in childbirth, Jedi Knight [[Anakin Skywalker]] is tasked by the Council to spy on [[Palpatine]], the Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic and, secretly, the Dark Lord of the Sith Darth Sidious. [spoilers]Sidious manipulates Anakin into turning to the dark side of the Force and becoming his apprentice, [[Darth Vader]], with wide-ranging consequences for the galaxy.[/spoilers]
